intro: Cyrtandra oblongifolia var. nervosa, commonly known as the nervy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with distinct venation patterns. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
